title: Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Double Desk-Ebony, Chrome", July 9, 1934
medium: Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/501 MADISON AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite on verso, lower left: 7797 DOUBLE DESK; inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 7797/F.S./RAND JOB/ALL MACASSAR EBONY/&BRUSHED CHROM./PULLS & BASE, Olsson/D./7/7.34, 8/9/34, 1, S.H.K.; inscribed in graphite above perspective drawing: PENCIL TRAY, INSIDE/SLIDE; below perspective drawing: WASTE PAPER/BASKET/PULLS & BASE/BRUSHED CHROM., ALL MACASSAR EBONY; below: INTERIORS - SYCAMORE/DOUBLE DESK.; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawing for double desk in macassar ebony. Pedestal legs at left and right with three stacked drawers; vertical pulls on each at center, appears to be unified pull. Pulls and base of desk in brushed chrome. Drawers on both sides at center, above knee hole. Pencil tray within center drawers holds clips, rubber bands, stamps, and tacks. Metal waste paper basket in left pedestal on each side.
